subject: Travel
title: Selfie Tourism Problems
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Selfie Tourism Problems.

hook.text: More people die from selfie accidents each year than from shark attacks. Tourism has a vanity problem.

buildup.text: Tourists climb restricted monuments, block sacred rituals, and trespass into private areas for photos.

discovery.text: India installed 'no-selfie zones' after dozens of deaths at cliffs, railways, and waterfalls.

twist.text: In Bali, tourists posing half-dressed at temples led to new 'tourist behavior' laws with fines.

climax.text: Amsterdam renamed its tourism board to discourage visitors. The city actively tells tourists not to come.

punchline.text: Some cities became so popular they started saying no.

quiz.question: Why did India install 'no-selfie zones'?
options: Dozens of people died taking selfies
